intro: Tapinanthus buntingii, commonly known as the parasitic milkweed, is a hemiparasitic plant that derives some of its nutrients from host plants. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is native to southern Africa. The plant has a distinctive appearance with yellow flowers and a branching structure. It lacks true leaves but has scale-like structures called phyllodes. Tapinanthus buntingii is often found growing on the roots of other plants, such as Acacia species.
